results.title: Treatment of lithium induced tremor with atenolol.

results.title: Effect on finger tremor of withdrawal of long-term treatment with propranolol or atenolol.
results.text_hl: Effect on finger @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@tremor@@@ of withdrawal of long-term treatment with @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Wharrad HJ, Birmingham AT, Wilson CG, Williams EJ, Roland JM. Effect on finger tremor of withdrawal of long-term treatment with propranolol or atenolol. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1984 Sep;18(3):317-24. PMID: 6487471

results.title: Characterization of the beta-adrenoreceptors which mediate the isoprenaline-induced changes in finger tremor and cardiovascular function in man.
results.text_hl: Finger @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@tremor@@@ responses to @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@ were antagonized by @CHEMICAL_ICI_118551 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026777 @@@ICI 118551@@@ alone and in combination with @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ but not by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ alone, suggesting that the response is @GENE_ADRB2 @GENE_154 @@@beta 2-adrenoceptor@@@-mediated.

citations.NLM: Pringle TH, Riddell JG, Shanks RG. Characterization of the beta-adrenoreceptors which mediate the isoprenaline-induced changes in finger tremor and cardiovascular function in man. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1988;35(5):507-14. PMID: 2853055
citations.BibTeX: @article{2853055, title={Characterization of the beta-adrenoreceptors which mediate the isoprenaline-induced changes in finger tremor and cardiovascular function in man.}, author={Pringle TH and Riddell JG and Shanks RG}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={35}, number={5}, pages={507-14}}

results.title: Effects of beta-adrenergic blockers on drug-induced tremors.
results.text_hl: To investigate what property of beta-blockers plays the main role in suppressing @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@tremor@@@, we employed five beta-blockers (@CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Butoxamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002078 @@@butoxamine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_arotinolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:C024523 @@@arotinolol@@@).

citations.NLM: Iwata S, Nomoto M, Fukuda T. Effects of beta-adrenergic blockers on drug-induced tremors. Pharmacol Biochem Behav. 1993 Mar;44(3):611-3. PMID: 8095722
citations.BibTeX: @article{8095722, title={Effects of beta-adrenergic blockers on drug-induced tremors.}, author={Iwata S and Nomoto M and Fukuda T}, journal={Pharmacol Biochem Behav}, volume={44}, number={3}, pages={611-3}}

results.title: Effect of atenolol, metoprolol, and propranolol on isoproterenol-induced tremor and tachycardia in normal subjects.
results.text_hl: Effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ on @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoproterenol@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@tremor@@@ and @DISEASE_Tachycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D013610 @@@tachycardia@@@ in normal subjects.

citations.NLM: Perucca E, Pickles H, Richens A. Effect of atenolol, metoprolol, and propranolol on isoproterenol-induced tremor and tachycardia in normal subjects. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1981 Apr;29(4):425-33. PMID: 6258838
citations.BibTeX: @article{6258838, title={Effect of atenolol, metoprolol, and propranolol on isoproterenol-induced tremor and tachycardia in normal subjects.}, author={Perucca E and Pickles H and Richens A}, journal={Clin Pharmacol Ther}, volume={29}, number={4}, pages={425-33}}

results.title: The effects of chronic dosing on the beta 1 and beta 2-adrenoceptor antagonism of betaxolol and atenolol.
results.text_hl: Dose-ratios for attenuation of @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@finger tremor@@@ (IT100) were significantly greater with B40 compared with B10 or A100 (no dose-ratio for @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@finger tremor@@@ could be calculated for N40).

citations.NLM: Lipworth BJ, Irvine NA, McDevitt DG. The effects of chronic dosing on the beta 1 and beta 2-adrenoceptor antagonism of betaxolol and atenolol. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1991;40(5):467-71. PMID: 1653143
citations.BibTeX: @article{1653143, title={The effects of chronic dosing on the beta 1 and beta 2-adrenoceptor antagonism of betaxolol and atenolol.}, author={Lipworth BJ and Irvine NA and McDevitt DG}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={40}, number={5}, pages={467-71}}

results.title: Effects of betaxolol, propranolol, and atenolol on isoproterenol-induced beta-adrenoceptor responses.
results.text_hl: The ascending order of potency of the drugs in preventing the changes in heart rate, finger @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@tremor@@@, diastolic blood pressure, forearm blood flow, and forearm vascular resistance induced by @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoproterenol@@@ was placebo, 10 mg @CHEMICAL_Betaxolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015784 @@@betaxolol@@@, 50 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 40 mg @CHEMICAL_Betaxolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015784 @@@betaxolol@@@, and 40 mg @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Riddell JG, Shanks RG. Effects of betaxolol, propranolol, and atenolol on isoproterenol-induced beta-adrenoceptor responses. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1985 Nov;38(5):554-9. PMID: 2865028
citations.BibTeX: @article{2865028, title={Effects of betaxolol, propranolol, and atenolol on isoproterenol-induced beta-adrenoceptor responses.}, author={Riddell JG and Shanks RG}, journal={Clin Pharmacol Ther}, volume={38}, number={5}, pages={554-9}}

results.title: Controlled-release metoprolol compared with atenolol in asthmatic patients: interaction with terbutaline.
results.text_hl: The @CHEMICAL_Terbutaline @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013726 @@@terbutaline@@@-induced skeletal @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@muscle tremor@@@ and increase in heart rate were less after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ than after either dose of metoprolol CR, also suggesting less interaction of metoprolol CR with beta 2-receptors.

citations.NLM: Löfdahl CG, Dahlöf C, Westergren G, Olofsson B, Svedmyr N. Controlled-release metoprolol compared with atenolol in asthmatic patients: interaction with terbutaline. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1988;33 Suppl():S25-32. PMID: 2836204
citations.BibTeX: @article{2836204, title={Controlled-release metoprolol compared with atenolol in asthmatic patients: interaction with terbutaline.}, author={Löfdahl CG and Dahlöf C and Westergren G and Olofsson B and Svedmyr N}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={33 Suppl}, pages={S25-32}}

results.title: The tremorolytic action of beta-adrenoceptor blockers in essential, physiological and isoprenaline-induced tremor is mediated by beta-adrenoceptors located in a deep peripheral compartment.
results.text_hl: The effects of intravenous @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ 100 micrograms kg-1, @CHEMICAL_Sotalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013015 @@@sotalol@@@ 500 micrograms kg-1, @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@ 7.8 micrograms kg-1, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 125 micrograms kg-1 and placebo on essential, physiological and @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@tremor@@@ were studied.

citations.NLM: Abila B, Wilson JF, Marshall RW, Richens A. The tremorolytic action of beta-adrenoceptor blockers in essential, physiological and isoprenaline-induced tremor is mediated by beta-adrenoceptors located in a deep peripheral compartment. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1985 Oct;20(4):369-76. PMID: 2866785
citations.BibTeX: @article{2866785, title={The tremorolytic action of beta-adrenoceptor blockers in essential, physiological and isoprenaline-induced tremor is mediated by beta-adrenoceptors located in a deep peripheral compartment.}, author={Abila B and Wilson JF and Marshall RW and Richens A}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={20}, number={4}, pages={369-76}}

results.title: beta-Adrenoreceptor antagonists in essential tremor.
results.text_hl: All three drugs produced an equal reduction in standing pulse rate but @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was less effective in reducing @<m>DISEASE_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014202 @@@tremor@@@ than @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Sotalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013015 @@@sotalol@@@.

citations.NLM: Jefferson D, Jenner P, Marsden CD. beta-Adrenoreceptor antagonists in essential tremor. J Neurol Neurosurg Psychiatry. 1979 Oct;42(10):904-9. PMID: 512665
citations.BibTeX: @article{512665, title={beta-Adrenoreceptor antagonists in essential tremor.}, author={Jefferson D and Jenner P and Marsden CD}, journal={J Neurol Neurosurg Psychiatry}, volume={42}, number={10}, pages={904-9}}
